page.title: 08TRANSPORT IN COUNTESTHORPE
page.content: The most popular form of transport is cars because of their speed and efficiency.Although they are one of the most expensive forms of transport with petrol at nearly Â£1.90 a gallon. Most families own a car. Bikes are probably the cheapest form of transport used but they are not the most popular because they don't go very fast although they reach speeds of 30-40mph in races.Nearly all children own a bike.And many people use a bike to cycle to work. Buses come through our village every half an hour and cost 75p for a child and for an adult Â£1.40 for a return to Leicester.They are very much slower than a car though a lot of people use the bus service.The name of the bus service is Midland Fox.It is quite an old service,the colours of the buses are red and yellow.
